title: Kenya: KRA Extends Filing of Tax Returns to Sunday, Itax Portal Hit 2 Million Users
text:
Kenya: Samsung's Mid-Range Galaxy J1 Suffers Excessive Lag 
The number is expected to rise with the extension of the deadline, with those yet to register enjoying no penalties for returns filed by the new deadline, Njiraini said. 
"Our intention is not to punish but to encourage Kenyans to get onto the iTax platform," he said in a statement to newsrooms on Thursday. 
"By this we will reduce the inconvenience tax payers go through in accessing services and reduce the burden we have to go through as well." 
KRA has registered more than 50,000 new iTax users, daily, since June, Njiraini said, adding that the number is expected to reach 4 million by July. 
"This is the first time in Kenya's history, that such a technology based solution has been activated as part of the ongoing tax and revenue reform programs at KRA," he said. 
The system, which underwent a hitch, saw many tax payers filing the returns manually. 
More than 118,000 taxpayers have filed their returns manually, Njiraini reported. 
He said KRA will assist users to ensure all returns are filed by the end of the week. 
The authority had been conducting training and sensitisation campaigns countrywide. 
The platform was set up in 2013 to help net revenue from non-compliant taxpayers and those under-declaring amounts. 
Once logged onto the system, a user can monitor their tax positions and manage their ledger pages in addition to filing returns. 
A simplified mode for the informal sector is underway, Njiraini said. 
After surpassing the Sh1 trillion revenue collection mark in June, KRA will rely on IT systems to seal all loopholes, he said. Kenya
